unnormalised: IIT Delhi just launched a new AI research center, folks! Heard it's funded with â‚¹20 crore for the next 5 yrs. They're planning to focus on AI ethics and explainability, which is really important, IMO. Seems like they are trying to address the whole "black box" concern with current AI models.
normalised: I-I-T Delhi just launched a new A-I research center, folks! Heard it's funded with rupee twenty crore for the next five years. They're planning to focus on A-I ethics and explainability, which is really important, in my opinion. Seems like they are trying to address the whole "black box" concern with current A-I models.

unnormalised: The center, called the "AI Future Foundation," aims to partner with industry giants like TCS and Infosys. Word is, they'll be working on projects like developing AI for healthcare diagnostics and improving traffic management in cities like Mumbai. Exciting stuff!
normalised: The center, called the "A-I Future Foundation," aims to partner with industry giants like T-C-S and Infosys. Word is, they'll be working on projects like developing A-I for healthcare diagnostics and improving traffic management in cities like Mumbai. Exciting stuff!

unnormalised: Prof. Ravi Kumar will head the center. In his statement, he said they want to train 1000 AI professionals in the next 3 yrs. That's a big boost for India's AI talent pool. Also, supposedly 20% of the funds are earmarked for scholarships for students from rural areas.
normalised: Professor Ravi Kumar will head the center. In his statement, he said they want to train one thousand A-I professionals in the next three years. That's a big boost for India's A-I talent pool. Also, supposedly twenty percent of the funds are earmarked for scholarships for students from rural areas.

unnormalised: Plus, they are hosting a kickoff conference on 15/08/2024 (Independence Day!) where they will release a white paper on "AI for Bharat." Something to keep an eye on, tech enthusiasts!
normalised: Plus, they are hosting a kickoff conference on fifteenth August two thousand and twenty four (Independence Day!) where they will release a white paper on "A-I for Bharat." Something to keep an eye on, tech enthusiasts!
